name: Suite Novotel Paris Roissy CDG

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel every year for the last 10 years; Mainly because we are a family of four and and this is the only hotel around that allows 4 people to a room; But besides that, we have always found this hotel very reasonable in price (free parking!) and VERY clean; The rooms are spacious and comfortable; Also, there is an airport shuttle that runs often that is free; The hotel is in the town of Roissy which offers good dining options, a bakery for yummy croissants in the AM (much cheaper than the hotel breakfast) and a supermarket; I would not hesitate to recommend staying here if you are needing a one nighter for a flight in or out of CDG
reviews.title: Great place to stay for an overnight at the airport

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night before a flight from CDG. The rooms were surprisingly spacious and well appointed with a large desk, a microwave and tea and coffee making facilities. The good wifi signal was much appreciated. My only issue was with the non-existent drainage in the shower resulting in the bathroom floor being completely flooded. The breakfast was quite adequate. The shuffle service to the airport was regular and efficient. An added bonus is the village which starts virtually across the road which has a supermarket and some restaurants and pretty gardens who wander through
reviews.title: Good for an overnight stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the gecko this hotel was amazing. We booked through booking.com (always the easiest to book with) five hours before we were due to arrive at Paris CDG Airport. When we arrived the room was ready and it included a microwave, kettle, tea, coffee, cakes and munchies. This room (room 203) was the best set out room ever. It had plenty of space, a queen and a single bed, table and chairs, separate toilet, great bathroom with a wonderful sized bath and a huge separate shower, very modern. The beds were comfortable with quilts and plenty of pillows. Perfect for people due to hop on a plane the next day. Very, very clean.The breakfast was extra but was good, choose your own from a cafeteria style set up. Every thing was packed in plastic cups and disposable. There was cereal, crossaints, juice, toast, coffee, tea, hot chocolate. Also cold meats, boiled eggs, cheeses etc.
reviews.title: Cannot get better anywhere

reviews.text: Amazing surprise for an airport hotel, the best set out room I have ever experienced. And being at the airport, really, really quiet, no noises at all.
reviews.title: Pleasant airport hotel layover site

reviews.text: Subject: Novotel Convention & Wellness Roissy CDG
reviews.title: OK for one night but food availability is poor

reviews.text: Once you figure out how to get there, it's a good stay. Staff is friendly, rooms are rather large with thoughtful appointments. Bkfst is a bit pricey, in containers for the most part, but quite tasty.
reviews.title: Convenient, clean and efficient

reviews.text: We went to this hotel on April 2012 (2 nights) and in May 2012 (2 nights).
reviews.title: Excellent hotel to travel with kids.
No Response
reviews.text: We loved this place. It is close to the airport and there is a free shuttle that runs frequently from the hotel to the CDG airport. It is running about every 20 minutes and you can use it as many times as you want, so you can use it to get to the train station at CDG and use the "RER B" train to visit anywhere in Paris from there.

It takes about 5 minutes to get from the hotel to the airport (Terminal 1-3), but the ride from the airport to the hotel is a little longer (15-20 minutes). It is a big shuttle bus that could accommodates a lot of people with there luggage's but be aware that if you take if from CDG Terminal #2 it could be a little overcrowded since it picks up travelers from terminal 1-3 first. If you take the shuttle from the airport to the hotel, be careful since there are many Novotel in the area. You must pick the shuttle that is going to "Allée du Verger - Mercure - Suite Novotel", not the one that goes to "Novotel Paris Nord 2".
reviews.title: I'd surely stay here again, tres biene

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: About the hotel itself, it is clean, comfortable and provides a lot of services.
reviews.title: Expensive but Convenient

reviews.text: Stayed here after 5 nights in downtown Paris since I had an early flight the next day. I would highly recommend staying close to CDG if you have an early flight as getting there is a huge pain from downtown Paris and lines in the morning are terrible. Positives: Hotel is new, clean and rooms are HUGE especially compared to downtown Paris. Bathroom clean and modern with separate door and area for the toilet. There is also a small kitchenette and large study area. Check in was a breeze and staff were overall polite and helpful, especially since most guests did not speak French. Negatives: Only real one is no hotel restaurant just a fridge where you can buy ready made food but their sister property down the street has a restaurant. This place is good for just the night as there is nothing around there.
reviews.title: Nice hotel near CDG

reviews.text: It is a new hotel, but our problem was lock of information. I placed call ahead, before we arrived to the hotel ( we had early flight from Paris, and decided to spend last night in airport hotel).No one gave me any information.. We took a shuttle with sign Novotel Suite, after 20 minutes ride and staying in a line we were told that we took a wrong shuttle, they have two hotels in CDG with the same name. I wonder why when I called to hotel no one warned me about it. So we had to take shuttle back, then wait for another shuttle. Overall we spend about 1.5 hours to get to the hotel. It was a disaster.We end up paying $130 for 4-5 hours of sleep...Another concern was hall in a bathroom door, especially when you sharing room with when you sharing room with kids/ or somebody else ( co-worker, friend)
reviews.title: Shuttle warning

reviews.text: We decided to stay close to the airport for our last night in Paris so we wouldn't have to deal with traffic or trains in the morning. Suite Novotel offered a reasonable price for a suite with a full size bed for my spouse and me, and twin sized beds for the two kids. One of the twin beds pulled out from under our bed, so there wasn't much space to walk around in the room, but that was fine for just one night. There was a "wicker" room divider that pulled out on one side and across the room to divide the parent's sleeping area from the kids. My only complaint was that the bed was VERY firm (some folks like it that way, I know). The room decor was very modern and European, which was nice for our last night in Europe!
reviews.title: Airport Close and Family Friendly

reviews.text: There were two bathrooms - one with sink and shower and one with sink and toilet, which helped when getting ready for bed and in the morning. The bathroom was a step up from the room - hard to remember in the middle of the night! Everything was sparkling clean.
reviews.title: My new 'go to' CDG Hotel!

reviews.text: For a few extra Euros we purchased breakfast when we checked in. We enjoyed yogurt, pastries, fruit and cereal. It was great to be able to send our teens down to eat while we finished getting ready in the morning.
reviews.title: Stay here, rent a car and drive to Paris city centre!

reviews.text: I am very picky with hotels and spent hours researching the hotels in this area. I was very pleased with the hotel and think I made a good choice. Very clean and well kept. Close to airport and the shuttle is not as confusing as others make it out to be, just follow the instructions. I would stay again. Also, plenty of restaurants in walking distance.
reviews.title: Solid Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked for directions in the airport for the shuttle buses. Depending on the time of day, the bus wait may be 20-40 minutes. It took us awhile to figure out the bus for the hotel. It is one of the Accor buses but it must say Aller de Verges or else you ride around the area and end up back at the airport. We counted 3 different Novotel hotels in the area. The room is dated but spacious compared to European horels.It was very clean . We walked through the village and found only the Chinese restaurant open on Saturday night. The map at reception was helpful in the village. There is a small park and playground for kids. The afternoon guy at the reception was cold. Breakfast was 10 euros and parking was high as well. We ate at the airport near gate K45 great food .
reviews.title: One night stay near CDG airport

aka: Suite Novotel Paris Roissy Cdg Hotel Roissy
description: 3 star hotel. 5 min from Roissy Charles de Gaulle airport,7 min from the Villepinte exhibition ground.Free shuttle services to the airport and the TGV and RER train stations.148 inviting modular suites with air conditioning, 30sqm in size. Friendly atmosphere. 24hr services include Boutique Gourmande gourmet food counter, gym, business corner with WiFi access and free high speed Internet. Bar, free massage Thursdays, undercover private pay car park. Accessible for persons with limited mobility.
